ISSUE.TITLE: Building on Windows 0.9.19
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: node --version: v16.2.0 OS: Windows 10 20H2 When trying to test out the seed project, I kept getting `node-gyp` errors due to `node-pty-prebuilt-multiarch`. The older version of `node-gyp 3.8.0` works with python2 and VS2017. I recently updated my workspace to use pyhton3 by default with VS2019, hence the issue with the older `node-gyp`. I manually updated the following: - `nc-lib-gui` dependecy to `"node-pty-prebuilt-multiarch": "^0.10.0"` - `ncocodb` dependency to `"sqlite3": "5.0.2"` (5.0.0 uses the old node-gyp as well) After the changes I was able to install `nocodb` and build it via npm. However, after building and trying to run the seed project, the program silently crashes.
